metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5985 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
lxc-user-nic in Linux Containers (LXC) allows local users with a lxc-usernet allocation to create network interfaces on the host and choose the name of those interfaces by leveraging lack of netns ownership check.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5985` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

liblxc1 - 1.0.9-0ubuntu3
lxc - 1.0.9-0ubuntu3
lxc-templates - 1.0.9-0ubuntu3
lxc-tests - 1.0.9-0ubuntu3
python3-lxc - 1.0.9-0ubuntu3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: lxc package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.9-0ubuntu3').
